main event: The report provides details of a UFO sighting involving a silver object observed by a military crew in the vicinity of Syracuse, New York and Plattsburgh AFB, New York on April 19, 1958.
interesting points: The object was initially mistaken for a balloon but did not disappear as rapidly as expected, leading to close observation by the crew.
The object appeared stationary at times and then moved in a straight line, circling the P-47 aircraft for approximately 8 minutes.
The crew of the P-47D aircraft described the object as oval and conical in shape with a blue-green tint.
The object was observed for approximately 15 minutes and then disappeared, with the aircraft crew and radar indicating altitude changes and movements.
The report includes information about the time, date, location, altitude, and identification of the observers involved in the sighting.
sighted object: silver oval and conical object with a blue-green tint
location: vicinity of Syracuse, New York and Plattsburgh AFB, New York
witnesses: military crew of a P-47D aircraft (Captain, Co-Pilot, Navigator)
